content: samantha s white claw / skinny can koozie materials 5 00mm h hook cotton medium-weight yarn two colors 1 mc - 6 single_crochet join in 1st single_crochet w/ a slip_stitch chain 1 6 2 starting in same single_crochet as slip_stitch increase x 6 join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 12 3 increase+single_crochet x 6 join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 18 4 increase+2 single_crochet x 6 join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 24 tag me on instagram if you make one @cutecraftycozy 5 increase+11sc x 2 join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 26 6 single_crochet in same single_crochet as slip_stitch then single_crochet in blo x 25 join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 26 7-8 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 26 9 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch fo 10 attach new color in starting single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 26 11 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 26 12 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch fo 26 13 attach first color in starting single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet around 26 14-24 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch chain 1 26 25 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch fo 26 26 attach second color in starting single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch fo 26 27 attach first color in starting single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch fo 26 weave in ends and enjoy notes always start new round in same single_crochet as slip_stitch this ensures the color stripes are even but you can work in the round if you prefer you can add another row of your contrast color after row 11 for a wider color stripe at the bottom do more or fewer row in the 14-25 segment to get the height you want etc the koozie may be a tight fit at first but it will stretch after a bit of use and still fit snugly questions comments email me cutecraftycozy@gmail com message me on instagram @cutecraftycozy
